mods.abstract: Kiddiejoy baby, made in Germany, 25cm including pillow couch, bisque head on cloth with celluloid hands, closed mouth, blue sleeping eyes, flange neck; pillow couch, doll and dress are machine-made. It was manufactured by Armand Marseille and designed as a competitor for the Bye-Lo Baby designed by Grace Putnam. The Kiddiejoy baby was manufactured beginning in 1922 and distributed through the New York firm, Jacobs & Kassler.
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

CONTENTdmData.dmGetItemInfo: {"title":"Bye-lo Baby","descri":"Bye-Lo Baby, made in Germany, 3 days old baby, 25cm including pillow couch, bisque head on cloth with celluloid hands, closed mouth, blue sleeping eyes, flange neck, Bye-Lo Baby is lying on white, lace decorated pillow couch, doll and dress are machine-made. It was designed by Grace Story Putnam in 1920s. Model was a live baby, when the Bye-Lo Baby came on the market, its success was immediate. The newspaper called it 'The Million Dollar Baby', Grace Story Putnam was a water colorist. After their divorce in the early 1920s, she determined to create a doll in imitation of a baby about three days old and searched the hospitals of Los Angeles in search of a perfect model, finding one eventually in a salvation army home. (Ref. 1) Another source indicated that this doll is the Dream Baby.","notes":"25 cm","date":"1924","coverb":"1920s","subjec":"Dolls","covera":"North America","proven":"USA","provea":{},"associ":{},"source":"Box 16","object":{},"creato":{},"contri":{},"publis":{},"type":{},"format":{},"identi":{},"langua":{},"relati":{},"rights":{},"catlog":{},"catalo":{},"plugin":{},"image":{},"imaga":{},"color":{},"extent":{},"imagb":{},"file":{},"hardwa":{},"digiti":{},"digita":{},"contac":"E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments.
